tasks.task: Conduct a tour of a drip irrigation system.
subtasks: Explain the use of drip tubing instead of PVC pipe.
Describe the importance of connecting the system to a back pressure valve.
Discuss the benefits of using a timer with the system.
Demonstrate how to connect the system to a spigot.
Show the use of a 200 mesh screen filter to prevent clogs.
Explain the function of a pressure reducer.
Illustrate the process of using T-tape for watering crops.
Demonstrate how to crimp drip tape ends.
Show the use of inline emitters for adjusting water output.
Explain the placement of the drip system throughout the garden.
Describe the system's ability to reduce weed growth.
Discuss the compatibility of the system with chickens and fruit trees.

tasks.task: Install a component of the drip irrigation system.
subtasks: Disassemble the system.
Replace the 200 mesh screen filter with a higher mesh count.
Install a pressure regulator.
Connect a new quarter-inch line for an additional plant.
Test the new setup with a bucket to check flow rate.

tasks.task: Oversee plant growth supported by the drip system.
subtasks: Monitor the water usage of different crops.
Apply fertilizer through the drip system.
Harvest crops as they mature.
Rotate crops in the garden beds.
Manage pests and diseases in the well-watered areas.

tasks.task: Maintain and troubleshoot the drip system.
subtasks: Regularly check for leaks or clogs.
Replace worn-out components.
Adjust the timer settings as needed.
Document system efficiency over time.
Share maintenance tips with viewers.
